climbs.name: Yogini
climbs.fa: James and Franziska Garrett, Julia "The Yogini" Geisler and Will Maxwell, 29 April 2007

content.description:
Like many other Ibex routes, this is a route that requires some creative Yogini type poses to climb it at the noted grade and I think you will find it very enjoyable. Laybacks to mantles to thin face to gaston to arrow poses, it has alot to offer! May be climbed in one long pitch, but beware of rope drag.

Pitch #1: Climb a few typical Ibex bulges past 4 bolts to a two-bolt quasi hanging belay or belay out right in the slot. 5.10, 20m.

Pitch #2: Crimps and balancy edges and finger pockets up a steepish wall to a slab and another tricky step past 2 bolts to a two-bolt belay. 5.10b, 35m.

Rappel the route. A top two-bolt belay and a couple of new bolts have been recently added.
content.protection: QDs. Bolts supplemented by gear on the SE corner of the Madness Buttress. A few micro to small cams to #2 Camalot should suffice. Two bolt belay stations at each anchor. Drilled on the lead. Well protected.
content.location:
Walk around the corner left side of Madness Buttress.

Note that this starts on a second-level ledge or tier. If you're looking at a bulge and thinking, "There's no way that's 5.9..." and "where're the bolts" then head left and up to the next level.

climbs.name: Question of Insanity
climbs.fa: Eric Marchese, Tim Toula, James Garrett; Mar 2001

content.description:
A nerve-wracking, thin, technical, and delicate trip from the anchors to the first bolt leads to some hard, painful pulling on tiny edges with desperately suspect feet up to a hidden clipping jug for the second bolt. Easier terrain through another bolt and then another head-scratching bit past the fourth and last bolt.

After the last bolt head a bit right into the obvious crack which protects well with medium to large nuts and cams (an orange metolius protected well the opening moves to get established up in the crack). Somewhat burly liebacking with less-than-stellar feet for 30 feet or so and then some 15-20 feet of easier but unprotected climbing to the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a single set of nuts and cams from finger- to fist-sized. Chain anchors at bottom and top.
content.location:
Climb the first pitch of

Territory of the Mad

and end at the chains rather than at the base of the arch.

From the chains head more-or-less straight up.

content.description:
P1

: Start on the arete moving past a few bolts and small TCU's to a ledge and a 2 bolt anchor. 5.10-

P2

: Crank steep bouldery move off of the ledge, tricky slab awaits you after pulling this, all bolts to a 2 bolt anchor on a sweet ledge. 5.11+/12a

P3

: Climb up and right into the obvious corner, bring handsized gear, aim for the " 1/2 softball" jug, clip a bolt at the lip, throw a sweet travserse around the corner to a devious vertical crux. 5.12-. Rap from the top anchor, join the raps on

Territory of the Mad

.
content.protection:
#0 Metoilus to #4 Camalot. slings helpful, re-placement slings really helpfull for top rap back to

Territory Of The Mad

.
content.location: If you are facing the buttress the route starts out of the gully that flanks the buttresses right side. Look for the arete on the left side of the gully while your hiking up.
